comment: Probably one of the best professor to have ever been a student of. He is a figure of the Nuclear field and has inspired some many students to pursue that field. If you have the chance to take him take it. Truly deserves all the credit for the KSU Nuclear minor. Wish I could have taken more classes with him. KSU didnt deserve a man so amazing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Ghavi is the best professor I've ever had. He is such a great lecturer, story teller, and comes up with the best metaphors. If you ever have the opportunity to take him for any class it will be a pleasure.

Dr. Ghavi is extremely smart and has a lot of nuclear engineering experience. His lectures are interesting and he provides many examples. You must attend to do well in class. He also allows a 1 page cheat sheet on his tests. He is very knowledgeable and I learned a lot from his class. Would highly recommend.
A clear professional person and he expects the same from students.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Great introduction to Nuclear. Dr. Ghavi clearly has a passion for the topic and makes the material very approachable. Textbooks would be beneficial, but good notes and attendance can get you through the course. The exams seemed easy if you pay attention in class and do the homework. Take this class junior year so you'll know if you want the minor!

Best professor hands down ive ever taken. Ive been through all the teachers in the EE department and some of the best from mechatronics but this guy is something else. If you love to learn then intro to nuclear is an absolute must before you graduate. If you dont youll end up like the guy on Cobb Parkway!!

Great professor overall. Knows the subject extremely well and has a great way of explaining it to his students. HWs aren't long, and Exams reflect well the material covered in class. Only downside was assigning a Lab Experiment/project the week before thanksgiving, due the week after thanksgiving.

Dr. Ghavi is a fantastic professor who manages to make a very daunting field, nuclear engineering, into something approachable and easy to learn (with some effort on your part). The only warning I might give is that he expects you to pay attention in class, so if you are on your phone (or laptop!) or half-asleep he WILL stop class and call you out.

Throughout your college career you will occasionally discover a professor that has a true passion for their field of study and their desire to share that knowledge and experience with others, Dr. Ghavi is that kind of professor. He will help you understand the incredible world of nuclear science and its application from an engineering perspective.

The greatest and most intelligent professor I have ever had the pleasure of taking. He conveys the material in a way that makes it impossible to not understand. If you come to class and listen you should have no trouble understanding the basics of nuclear engineering. Took for SYE3501, SYE3502, SYE4503; just wish he offered more courses. GO NUCLEAR
Very passionate about his subject and does his best to make you feel the same. Explains concepts and works through examples in class very well.
Awesome prof!, very clear in what he puts on tests......allows for a cheat sheet in test, really knows his nuclear physics

Dr. Ghavi is extremely passionate about Nuclear Engineering.  He does everything in his power to make sure that you understand the material he teaches.  As an industry professional for over 30 years, he brings real life experiences to the classroom.  Best teacher I have ever had!!!!!
